definition: sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse

sentences.english: and Nietzsche were kings of the aphorism.
sentences.chinese: 和尼采這樣的哲學家們是警句之王。

sentences.english: I have attempted also to write a series of literary epigrams under the general title " Cigar Ashes."
sentences.chinese: 我也曾以“煙屑”爲總題，試寫一些文藝方面的警句。

sentences.english: Some of the images are tagged with aphorisms or poems.
sentences.chinese: 有些畫面還配上了警句或詩。

sentences.english: Objective To study the value and the clinical application of the suspect epigrams of automated blood analyzer.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討血細胞分析儀異常警句在臨牀應用的價值。

sentences.english: Suddenly a surprising image or epigram will light up the scene.
sentences.chinese: 一個突如其來的形象或警句突然把意境照亮。

sentences.english: She could tattoo me with epigrams.
sentences.chinese: 她會用警句不斷地敲打我。

sentences.english: I collect your mottoes and sentences.
sentences.chinese: 我正在收集你的格言和警句。

sentences.english: Self epigram at the end of the stock market, while the value of investment success.
sentences.chinese: 自我在股市結束警句，而投資價值的成功。

sentences.english: Sunddly a image or epigram light up the whole mood.
sentences.chinese: 一個突如其來的形象或警句突然把意境照亮。

sentences.english: Even in his style there is something of a modern epigrammatic ring.
sentences.chinese: 即使在他的風格中也可見幾分現代警句的感覺。

sentences.english: An epigrammatic japanese verse form of three short lines.
sentences.chinese: 由三行短詩構成的警句式的日本詩。

sentences.english: Most epigrams exaggerate for effect, and this is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 警句爲了求效果大多言過其實，這句也不例外。

sentences.english: He could talk good sense and airy nonsense at discretion .
sentences.chinese: 他能隨意講述意味深長的警句和毫無意義的空談。

definition: quotation (from a book or existing source)
if you are lazy in your prime, you'll be sorry in your old age
pinyin: shao4 zhuang4 bu4 nu3 li4 , lao3 da4 tu2 shang1 bei1
related.word: 少壯不努力，老大徒傷悲
